Yep thats pretty much how it goes unless they press me to share it with who=
 the message is for and even then the timing has to be right. May be then, =
may be a year later but the messages always get thru to who they are meant =
to.
=A0
Misty

=A0 




As far as=
 I am concerned, for what it is worth-you seem to be going about it the rig=
ht way. As long as you remain open mindedly skeptical about any=A0knew info=
,=A0just as you did with the messages that were=A0for you, there is no prob=
lem with it at all, IMO.
=A0
It sounds like you don't discount it and you d=
on't buy into it, you just file it away to see what comes of it later.
=A0
=
Perfect :)
=A0

=A0 






There is no doubt in my mind =
about that. You are right April =3D) In the beginning I did seek some proof=
 for my own sanity. But time and time again I have learned much more than I=
 ever expected to. For me its=A0become more than about contact with my dead=
 loved ones, its more about learning and growing from the experiences. That=
 definitely has been the end result. 
=A0
Misty

=A0 


I would definitely call that proof. The strengt=
h of the proof is in the part that you knew nothing about what the message =
would mean to the person, or if it a message for you, it was some fact that=
 you had not known prior.
=A0
IMO, in this case there is no way it would be=
 a case matrixing or hearing what you wanted or expected to hear, that it w=
as real information conveyed through an intelligent source.
=A0

----- Orig=
inal Message ----- 
From: bulletbabea 
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
Sent: =
Wednesday, September 16, 2009 2:46 PM
Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: Voice inflecti=
ons?

=A0 

I think quite often when the message isn't for me and it's for =
someone outside of this research it matters very much that the message is s=
omething I myself would never know. It hits home so much more for the recip=
ient. To me it may seem dumb or meaningless but to the person who the messa=
ge is for it can have a deeper impact because they know theres no way possi=
ble I could know the info. And vice versa when the message is for me someti=
mes the info doesnt become clear til much later down the road when I learn =
that bit of info or watch that predictive message become reality. It's all =
very interesting and educational =3D)

Misty

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .c=
om, "April Abercrombie" <april@...> wrote:
>
> The only way to prove 100% t=
hat something you receive through the box is authentic communication, is if=
 they say something that you can verify, something you yourself did not kno=
w.
> 
> ----- Original Message ----- 
> From: Misty Dawn 
> To: EVP-ITC@yah=
oogroups .com 
> Sent: Wednesday, September 16, 2009 3:41 AM
> Subject: Re:=
 [EVP-ITC] Voice inflections?
> 
> 
> I have gotten many life like voices o=
ver the years. My first evp was my mothers voice and no boxes were involved=
. The box is a tool/method and there are many ways to get their voices hear=
d. So in the different methods I have used, yes I have heard voices that re=
semble their lifetime charachteristics and tones. Is it always that way? No=
. 
> 
> Most often the group will speak as one voice because I have request=
ed they do so. One voice tone will begin a sentence and another will end it=
. So I may hear my female friends voice start off a thought and an unknown =
male voice finish the sentence. And vice versa often they speak in tones wh=
ich do not even come close to what they sounded like in life. Quite often t=
hey are spirits I didnt know in life. I may get someone saying This is edis=
on, and then find an old recording he did where he starts it off saying Thi=
s is edison, but for me I do not know the man so there is no recognition fo=
r me. I document it and file it away as a curiousity.
> 
> I always laugh w=
hen people say thats not your mother or friend thats something trying to fo=
ol you and mess with your head. I knew my mother longer than anyone and its=
 interesting that it is easier for those people to believe that its possibl=
e that something/someone else is speaking pretending to be my mother but it=
s much harder for them to believe that quite possibly that really is my mot=
her keeping her promise to stay in touch after death. If one is possible th=
en so is the other. I tend to be stubborn in some respects in that I dont i=
nstantly believe what anyone tells me whether living or not. If they give m=
e a message I think is dumb I am very reluctant to pass it on and usually t=
hose are the ones that get the biggest confirmations tho it means nothing t=
o me at the time. So yes quite possibly evp work can be used the same as me=
diumship in missing persons cases.
> 
> For me tone of voice has grown to m=
ean nothing. It is a treat when they manage to come across sounding as they=
 did when in physical form here but I look beyond the tone of voice. Often =
people get a childs voice and they become saddened by the thought that a ch=
ild is earthbound. But I see it just as a representation of voice and wheth=
er it comes across as male female child or robot matters little to me.
> 
>=
 I do find they often resume the "character" they played because after all =
that is sort of what we are, characters in some giant play. Whether it is t=
he beliefs they had which were their trademark, the tone of voice, their im=
age, or use of some nickname even I dont know about I look at it all as jus=
t a pixel in a larger portrait that some part survives once the body has ce=
ased to function. And the message is simply, our energy continues on.
> 
> =
Quote by Einstein: 'Energy cannot be created or destroyed, it can only be c=
hanged from one form to another.'
> 
> Misty (the insomniac is up way toooo=
o late and rambling on LOL)
>

> I was googling about AM radio reception,=
 and I came across the below exchange on a forum. It talks about using the =
box to find missing persons (which I didn't know was possible), and the con=
versation mentions hearing specific voice inflections and recognizing a dea=
d person's specific voice on the box. My question is, do any of you get a r=
ecognizable voice? The voices I get always sound robotic, although I do get=
 clearly male or female voices. 
> 
> http://www.itcbridg e.com/forum/ view=
_topic. php?id=3D515& forum_id=3D 31
>
